section.title: vendors creating new Create New Vendor
section.para: To create a new Vendor, select the "New Vendor" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: Vendors can also be created from the CRM Account screen. Simply enter a new CRM Account, selecting the "Vendor" Relationship option.

section.para: When creating a new Vendor, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter a number to identify the Vendor.
Specify the Vendor Type of the Vendor.
Enter the name of the Vendor.
Select if you are actively doing business with this Vendor.
Use this field to indicate the Account number the Vendor assigns to your site.

note.para: If a new Address is manually entered here, that Address will be added automatically to the master list of Addresses.

listitem.para: Default settings for Vendor.
Specify the default billing Terms for the Vendor.
Specify default Ship Via for Vendor.
Specify the Currency to be used when conducting business transactions with the Vendor. This option will only be visible in systems configured to use multiple Currencies.

varlistentry.term:
free on board at receiving site
free on board vendor specified
FOB free on board Default FOB

listitem.para: Indicate the default Free on Board (FOB) destination by selecting one of the following options:
Select if receiving site is default FOB destination.
Select if Vendor specifies an FOB destination other than the receiving Site. Enter alternate FOB details in space provided.
Select if Vendor accepts Purchase Orders to render goods. This setting is informational only. It has no impact on the ordering process.
Select this flag to indicate that the Vendor is a trusted Vendor.

varlistentry.term: Check for matching Voucher and Purchase Order amounts

listitem.para: Select to perform Voucher matching when entering Voucher Items for the Vendor. If selected, users will be presented with a warning message whenever a Voucher Item amount does not match the corresponding Purchase Order Item amount for the Vendor. This option will not prevent users from proceeding. Instead, the warning message simply alerts users that a mis-match exists.

varlistentry.term: May only Sell Items defined by an Item Source

listitem.para: Select if you want to restrict Items purchased from the Vendor to Items having a defined Item Source. If not selected, you may choose from all purchased Items when entering a Purchase Order Line Item.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without creating a new Vendor, returning you to the application desktop.
Creates the Vendor and enters the Vendor into the master list of Vendors.
Select to open the Vendor master whose Vendor Number immediately follows the current Vendor Number.
Select to open the Vendor master whose Vendor Number immediately precedes the current Vendor Number.

section.para: To view or enter Vendor Tax information, select the "Tax" tab. The following screen will appear:

vendors tax information for
taxes for vendors When adding Vendor Tax information, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select if Vendor receives a 1099 federal Tax form.

varlistentry.term: tax zones default for vendors Default Tax Zone

listitem.para: Specify the primary Tax Zone you want to associate with the Vendor.
Display lists Tax Registration Numbers for the specified Vendor.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Opens screen for creating a new Vendor Tax Registration Number.

Enables you to edit highlighted Vendor Tax Registration Numbers. The edit screen is the same as that for creating a new Vendor Tax Registration Number—except that when editing, the fields will contain Vendor Tax Registration Number information. Double-clicking on a Vendor Tax Registration Number will also bring you to the editing screen.
Highlight a Vendor Tax Registration Number and then select this button to reach a read-only view of the "Edit" screen.
Highlight a Vendor Tax Registration Number and then select this button to remove the Vendor Tax Registration Number from the list.

section.para: To add a new Vendor Tax Registration Number, select the NEW button. The following screen will appear:

vendors tax registration for
taxes registration for vendors When adding a new Vendor Tax Registration Number, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Specify the Tax Zone associated with the Tax Registration Number.
Specify the Tax Authority associated with the Tax Registration Number.

Enter the Vendor's Tax Registration Number for the specified Tax Authority. The registration number is used by Tax Authorities to identify businesses and/or individuals. An Employer Identification Numbers (EIN) is an example of a Tax Registration Number.

tip.para: The Vendor's Tax Registration Number is used for identifying the Vendor to relevant Tax Authorities. This information should not be confused with the Tax Registration Numbers, which are used to identify your company to relevant Tax Authorities.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without creating a new Vendor Tax Registration Number, returning you to the previous screen.
Creates the Vendor Tax Registration Number and adds it to the master list of Vendor Tax Registration Numbers.

section.para: To view or enter Vendor contact information, select the "Contact Information" tab. The following screen will appear:
vendors contact information for When adding Vendor contact information, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Manually enter Contact information in the fields below—or use the browse button to select pre-existing Contact information. If a new Contact is manually entered here, that Contact will be added automatically to the master list of Contacts. For additional documentation related to creating Contacts, see .

Manually enter Contact information in the fields below—or use the browse button to select pre-existing Contact information. If a new Contact is manually entered here, that Contact will be added automatically to the master list of Contacts. For additional documentation related to creating Contacts, see .

section.para: Just as Customers may have multiple Ship-To addresses, Vendors may also maintain multiple Ship-From addresses. A Vendor address is a Ship-From address. To add Vendor Addresses to a Vendor master, select the "Addresses" tab. The following screen will appear:
When adding Vendor Addresses, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to present primary address used by Vendor. Manually enter Address information in the fields below—or use the browse button to select pre-existing Address information. By default, this address will appear as the main address when entering Purchase Orders for the Vendor. If a new Address is manually entered here, that Address will be added automatically to the master list of Addresses. For additional documentation related to creating Addresses, see .
Select to list various alternate Addresses for Vendor.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Runs the report associated with this screen.
Opens screen for creating a new Vendor Address.

Enables you to edit highlighted Vendor Address. The edit screen is the same as that for creating a new Vendor Address—except that when editing, the fields will contain Vendor Address information. Double-clicking on a Vendor Address will also bring you to the editing screen.
Highlight a Vendor Address and then select this button to reach a read-only view of the "Edit" screen.
Highlight a Vendor Address and then select this button to remove the Vendor from the list.

section.para: vendor addresses creating new To create a new Vendor Address, select the NEW button. The following screen will appear:
When creating a new Vendor Address, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter a number or code to identify the Vendor Address. Using the value "Remit" or "REMIT" or "remit" in this field will cause the specified Address to be used as the default Remit-To Address when printing Checks for the Vendor.

note.para: The Remit-To feature is only supported when printing Checks using the APCheck report definition.

listitem.para: Enter the name of the Vendor Address.

Manually enter Address information in the fields below—or use the browse button to select pre-existing Address information. By default, this address will appear as the main address when entering Purchase Orders for the Vendor. If a new Address is manually entered here, that Address will be added automatically to the master list of Addresses. For additional documentation related to creating Addresses, see .

Manually enter Contact information in the fields below—or use the browse button to select pre-existing Contact information. If a new Contact is manually entered here, that Contact will be added automatically to the master list of Contacts. For additional documentation related to creating Contacts, see .
This is a scrolling text field with word-wrapping for entering Comments related to the Vendor Address.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without creating a new Vendor Address, returning you to the previous screen.
Creates the Vendor Address and adds it to the master list of Vendor Addresses.

section.para: To add Notes related to a Vendor, select the "Notes" tab. The following screen will appear:
To add Comments related to a Vendor, select the "Comments" tab. The following screen will appear:
To add purchasing Notes related to a Vendor, select the "Order Notes" tab. The following screen will appear:
When adding purchasing Notes related to a Vendor, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select the "Order Notes" tab to access this scrolling text field with word-wrapping for entering purchasing Notes related to the Vendor.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without creating new purchasing Notes, returning you to the application desktop.
Creates the purchasing Notes and adds them to the Vendor master.

section.para: The Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) system enables you to exchange information electronically with your Vendors. To set up a Vendor to receive Purchase Orders, select the "Transmission" tab and select the "EDI Profiles" button. The following screen will appear:

note.para: The buttons to set up EDI Profiles are disabled when creating a new Vendor. If you want to set up EDI for a new Vendor, save the Vendor and edit it again.

section.para: To enable Automated Clearing House (ACH) Check printing for the Vendor, select the "Checks" radio button o n the "Transmissions" tab. The following options will appear:

listitem.para: Select to enable online processing or Automated Clearing House (ACH) Check printing.
Enter Bank Account Routing Number.
Enter Bank Account Check Number.
Select type of Bank Account associated with Routing and Account numbers.

varlistentry.term: Use Instead of Vendor Number and Name

listitem.para: Select to use alternative Vendor identification information other than Vendor Number and Name.
Enter alternate Vendor identification number (i.e., tax ID number).
Enter alternate Vendor name (i.e., name of parent company).
